intro: Leptostigma weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's leptostigma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pale blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
